source_findings.description: 'Schemas treated as Topologies' - topology has multiple mathematical meanings
'Continuous Maps (Functors)' - distinct mathematical concepts conflated
'sheaf-like constraint' is vague
'immutable within execution context' - context boundaries undefined
'Galois Connection' used loosely with adjoint pairs
'distributed compute frameworks' - which frameworks?
'Verification over Generation' - compile-time only or also runtime?
No user/persona definitions
No performance benchmarks
No deployment model specified
No data volume/scale expectations
No error recovery strategy
No API surface described
No schema versioning/migration strategy
No monitoring/alerting requirements
INT-006 Frobenius Algebra explicitly Speculative
INT-003 Universal applicability claims with no specific requirements
INT-005 Adjoint strategies at example level not spec level
